title: Joseph Bessala
text:
Joseph Bessala (1 January 1941 – 25 April 2010) was a <a href="welterweight">welterweight</a> <a href="boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>.
Amateur.
In 1965, Bessala won the <a href="1965%20All-Africa%20Games">All-Africa Games</a> in <a href="Brazzaville">Brazzaville</a>, <a href="Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Republic of the Congo</a>. He twice won the African Championships in welterweight: in 1966 in <a href="Lagos">Lagos</a>, <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>, (prevailing over <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>ian, <a href="Eddie%20Blay">Eddie Blay</a> in the final) and 1968 in <a href="Lusaka">Lusaka</a>, <a href="Zambia">Zambia</a>, where he prevailed in the final fight over the Zambian, <a href="Julius%20Luipa">Julius Luipa</a>, whom he beat again at the <a href="Olympic%20Games">Olympic Games</a>. He won the silver medal at the <a href="1968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968 Olympic Games</a> in <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a>. In the final, he was lost to <a href="German%20Democratic%20Republic">East Germany's</a> <a href="Manfred%20Wolke">Manfred Wolke</a>.

Professional.
In October, Bessala started his professional career with a victory, where he defeated the <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a>'s <a href="Jean-Pierre%20Heirmann">Jean-Pierre Heirmann</a> with a first-round technical knockout. Six victories, one draw, and yet another five victories followed. In November 1974, the last victory over <a href="Eddie%20Blay">Eddie Blay</a> from <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>, who had won the bronze medal in the class of <a href="super%20lightweight">super lightweight</a> in 1964, gained Bessala the African title in the welterweight class. The title was taken from him by <a href="Salem%20Ouedraogo">Salem Ouedraogo</a> from the <a href="C%C3%B4te%20d%27Ivoire">Côte d'Ivoire</a> in January 1976. After a longer break, Bessala gained back the African title from his fellow countryman, <a href="Bechir%20Boundka">Bechir Boundka</a> in June 1978. He aimed to defend this title again in his 16th fight, but <a href="Mimoun%20Mohatar">Mimoun Mohatar</a> from <a href="Morocco">Morocco</a> knocked him out in the 12th round in December 1978. Bessala retired from boxing shortly thereafter.
